para.text: DRT- Drain Return Package

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: DRT
Purpose
The Drain Return Package allows simulation of drains in which some of the water from the drain is used to recharge the aquifer.
Documentation

li.link: Banta, E.R., 2000, MODFLOW-2000, the U.S. Geological Survey Modular Ground-Water Model - Documentation of Packages for Simulating Evapotranspiration with a Segmented Function (ETS1) and Drains with Return Flow (DRT1): U.S. Geological Survey Open-File Report 00-466, 127 p.

Hanson, R.T., Boyce, S.E., Schmid, Wolfgang, Hughes, J.D., Mehl, S.M., Leake, S.A., Maddock, Thomas, III, and Niswonger, R.G., 2014, One-Water Hydrologic Flow Model (MODFLOW-OWHM): U.S. Geological Survey Techniques and Methods 6–A51, 120 p., http://dx.doi.org/10.3133/tm6A51.

para.text: Related Packages
Supported in
Other Notes
Special care must be taken when constructing the DRT package input file if the observations are used. See discussion of "
para.link: Observations at Cells Having More Than One Head-Dependent Boundary Feature Represented by the Same Package
para.text: " in the
(not included in MODFLOW-2005 or MODFLOW-LGR) input file.
The Drain-Return Observation Package (DTOB) is not included in MODFLOW-2005 or MODFLOW-LGR
Input Instructions
Input to the DRT1 Package is read from the file that has type “DRT” in the

file. Optional variables are shown in brackets. All variables are free format if the option “FREE” is specified in the Basic Package input file; otherwise, the non-optional variables have 10-character fields and the optional variables are free format.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: FOR EACH SIMULATION
Data Set 0
[#Text]
Item 0 is optional -- “#” must be in column 1. Item 0 can be repeated as many times as desired.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Text—is a character variable (79 characters) that starts in column 2. Any characters can be included in Text. The “#” character must be in column 1. Lines beginning with “#” are restricted to these first lines of the input file. Text is written to the LIST output file when the input file is read.
Data Set 1
MXADRT IDRTCB NPDRT MXL [Option]

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: MXADRT—is the maximum number of drain-return cells in use during any stress period. MXADRT includes cells that are defined using parameters as well as cells that are defined without using parameters.
Recipient cells are not included in MXADRT.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IDRTCB—is a flag and a unit number.

li.text: If IDRTCB > 0, it is the unit number to which DRT1-Package cell-by-cell flow terms will be written when “SAVE BUDGET” or a non-zero value for
is specified in Output Control (Harbaugh and others, 2000). IDRTCB must be a unit number associated with a file listed with type “DATA(BINARY)” or “DATAGLO(BINARY)” in the name file.
If IDRTCB = 0, DRT1-Package cell-by-cell flow terms will not be written.
If IDRTCB < 0, drain leakage for each drain-return cell and return flow to each recipient cell will be written to the LIST file when “SAVE BUDGET” or a non-zero value for

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NPDRT—is the number of drain-return parameters.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: MXL—is the maximum number of drain-return cells that will be defined using parameters. Recipient cells are not included in MXL. MXL must equal or exceed the sum of
×N for all parameters, where N is the greater of 1 and

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Option—is an optional list of character values.

li.text: abc” – defines an auxiliary variable (Harbaugh and McDonald, 1996a, p. 9, Item 4), named "abc," which will be read for each drain as part of Items 3 and 5. Up to 20 variables can be specified, each of which must be preceded by "
." These variables will not be used by the Groundwater Flow Process, but they will be available for use by other processes. The auxiliary variable values will be read after the Rfprop variable.

”—indicates that memory should be allocated to store cell-by-cell flow for each drain in order to make these flows available for use in other packages. (This option is only available in MODFLOW-2000.)
”—activates the return-flow option of the DRT1 Package. If “
” is listed as an option, LayR, and, optionally, RowR, ColR, and Rfprop are read from items 3 and(or) 5.

para.text: PRINTFILE
PRTFIL
The keyword is
PRINTFILE
followed by a unit number, PRTFIL, that is specified in the NAM. The unit number is where the DRT flow data is written.
This option is only available in MODFLOW-OWHM.

To facilitate parameter estimation, a new output file was added to the DRT to create observations for drain return flows. This output file prints to either a binary file or text (ASCII) file, a header and then all the drain cells’ locations, where drain water was sent to, and the flow rate. This option is activated by adding the option keyword PRINTFILE on Item 1, followed by a unit number of the file to which data will be written. For binary files, a set of static information is written for each drain location to be consistent. Below is an example written to a binary file where the variables are those previously defined in the DRT documentation or in the next section.
HEADER: ‘ DRAINS (DRT)’ KPER KSTP NDRTCL
DRN# Layer Row Column Q ‘ DRT ‘ LayR RowR ColR QIN
DRN# Layer Row Column Q ‘ DRT ‘ 0 0 0 0D0
DRN# Layer Row Column Q ‘ FMP ‘ LayR RowR 0 QIN
DRN# Layer Row Column Q ‘ SWR ‘ LayR RowR 0 QIN

The first record is a header that contains a string, the current stress period, time step, and the number of drains that will be printed. The subsequent records contain the current drain count, DRN#, the flow rate out of the drain cell, Q, a four-character string that indicates the package that the drain flow is sent to, and the flow rate into that package, QIN. Note that if Rfprop=1.0, then Q=QIN. The second entry represents when DRT functions like DRN and is specified with a zero layer, row, and column, and the type at the end of the line is set to zero because this drain flow is not returned within the model.
Repeat Items 2 and 3 for each parameter to be defined (that is,
times). Items 2 and 3 are omitted if
Data Set 2
[PARNAM PARTYP Parval NLST [
INSTANCES
NUMINST]]
If PARNAM is to be a time-varying parameter, the keyword “
INSTANCES
” and a value for NUMINST must be entered.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: PARNAM—is the name of a parameter to be defined. This name can consist of 1 to 10 characters and is not case sensitive. That is, any combination of the same characters with different case will be equivalent.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: PARTYP—is the type of parameter to be defined. For the DRT1 Package, the only allowed parameter type is “DRT,” which defines values of the drain hydraulic conductance.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NLST—is the number of drain-return cells included in a non-time-varying parameter or in each instance of a time-varying parameter.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: INSTANCES
– is an optional keyword that designates a parameter as time varying. The keyword is case-insensitive; that is, it may be entered in any combination of upper- and lower-case letters. If
INSTANCES
is present, it must be followed by a value for NUMINST. If
INSTANCES
is absent, PARNAM is non-time-varying and NUMINST should not be present.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NUMINST – is the number of instances that are included in the definition of a time-varying parameter, where each instance is a list of drain-return cells, associated recipient cells, and properties. If the keyword
INSTANCES
is present, NUMINST must be present and must be at least 1. If the keyword
INSTANCES
is absent, NUMINST should not be present.
Data Set 3a
INSTNAM
Item 3a is read only if
is time-varying.
repetitions of Item 3 (parts a and b) are read. After each repetition of Item 3a,
repetitions of Item 3b are read.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: INSTNAM – is the name of an instance associated with the parameter

specified in the corresponding Item 3. The name can consist of 1 to 10 characters and is not case sensitive. That is, any combination of the same characters with different case will be equivalent. Names entered for INSTNAM must be unique for any given parameter, but names may be reused for instances associated with different parameters.
Data Set 3b
Layer Row Column Elevation Condfact [LayR RowR ColR Rfprop] [xyz]
repetitions of Item 3b records are required; they are read by module
(Harbaugh and others, 2000). (
of the ULSTRD utility module applies to Condfact.) The
repetitions of Item 3b follow each repetition of Item 3a when
is time-varying.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Condfact—is the factor used to calculate drain hydraulic conductance from the parameter value. The conductance (L

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: /T) is the product of Condfact and the parameter value.
See also "
FOR EACH STRESS PERIOD
Data Set 4
ITMP NP

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: ITMP—is a flag and a counter.

li.text: If ITMP < 0, non-parameter drain-return data from the last stress period will be reused.
If ITMP ≥0, ITMP will be the number of non-parameter drain-return cells read for the current stress period.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NP—is the number of drain-return parameters in use in the current stress period.
Data Set 5
Layer Row Column Elevation Cond [LayR RowR ColR Rfprop] [xyz]
repetitions of Item 5 records are read by module
(Harbaugh and others, 2000) if
of the ULSTRD utility module applies to Cond). Item 5 is not read if

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Cond—is the hydraulic conductance of the interface between the aquifer and the drain.
See also "
Data Set 6
Pname [Iname]
Item 6 is repeated
times. It is not read if
≤0. Iname is read if Pname is a time-varying parameter.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Pname—is the name of a parameter being used in the current stress period.
parameter names will be read.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Iname – is an instance name that is read only if Pname is a time-varying parameter. Multiple instances of the same time-varying parameter are not allowed in a stress period.
